TopicTitle: How to edit persistent and save files

Articles.Content:
Specifically, there was a fuel line that fails to connect when reloading--I check the save file and it says "connected" but not to what (there are several, hard to tell which one's the culprit). So I have two questions: how to edit specific parts in the save file (and does it need to reconcile with the persistence file--if so, how?). Second, I had thought to just launch the craft once fixed in the VAB and paste it into the corrupted craft's place--instead, the only part that exists by that name is "debris"--a docking clamp and decoupler.

In my haste I modified the persistent file without backing it up, so woe to me. I'm really really really upset at this, because this specific project is about 80 hours of game time invested, and this is the farthest I've gotten. Anyhow, tips or guides on how to transpose craft files or fix broken parts within craft files would be appreciated. the next time.

I'd recommend using Notepad++, it makes editing a whole lot easier. Load the file, select "Language/P/Python", then the brackets are collapsible. You can collapse all by "view/Fold all", then open the brackets as necessary.

Editing a specific part is a bit tricky. I'd recommend loading a fixed copy on the pad and comparing them for differences. It appears that cData may be the line you're looking for

... the only part that exists by that name is "debris"--a docking clamp and decoupler.

...

That's odd, could you look around the file a bit more, maybe if there is a part that is unique to that vessel you could search for it.
